author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Had the same issue with the downloaded version of ethereal. It worked once I built from source. You can also try to use the pathto  the geth.ipc (in startup log) instead of 127.0.0.1 in the script

author: seamonkey82
content: I hit the faucet enough to cover eight validators.  Provided that I maintain my validators and promise to properly exit them if I choose to stop running them, is there a particular limit I should restrict myself to?  I figured I should ask as a matter of etiquette.

author: parithosh
content:
I guess it just depends on what you are trying to test or what you need the validators for ğŸ™‚
If you are testing some sort of infra, then feel free to onboard as many validators as needed to meaningfully test it.

author: seamonkey82
content: I'm a non-dev validating purely to be a part of the process.  I think my only "need" to run more validators would be to increase the chances of getting that sweet proposer cred. ğŸ˜  So... eight's probably enough, eh?

author: parithosh
content:
haha ğŸ˜„
Considering how few external validators there are currently, you'd definitely have some street cred ğŸ™‚

It would be great if you could write down the steps you used to get it up and running, your perspective would definitely be different. Or have a look at some of the other testing scenario's we have in the doc, maybe some seem interesting to you.
